attributes.title: Physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
Findings.

  •  A stock take of raw materials and finished product was conducted on 1st February 2025 to assess whether all stock items’ issues, receipts and usage were well controlled.
  • The items with variances were as stated below:
    • Polybags had a variance of +222 Pieces
    • Finished product had a variance of -49 Loaves.
    • Yeast  had a variance of -1.061
    • Wheat Bran -9.89 Kgs
    • Utto had a variance of -4.12 Ltrs /Kgs
  • The other raw materials had negligible variances as illustrated:
attributes.recommendation: • The branch management to implement stringent measures on raw materials’ movement to alleviate the variances.
attributes.effect: • The variances noted imply weakening of stock controls with regards to wheat bran, Utto and yeast materials’ movement.
attributes.remediation_plan: The branch management to strengthen controls in place to alleviate variances.

value:
•  The variance in Wheat bran was because we use 1.5 Kgs per mix yet in the system it is 1 Kg.
  • The shortfall in yeast was due to a yeast used to boost mixes in the morning when it is cold.

• The manager has been advised to ensure the wheat bran usage is as per system BOM.
  • The yeast was used to boost mixes in the morning when there was cold weather.
  • We will enhance controls to minimize variations.

In the prior audit report dated 6th December 2024 stock variances were as seen below:

  •   Bread -28 Loaves
  • White flour  +18.11 Kgs
  • Yeast +2 Sachets
  • Polybags -398 pieces
  • Utto-2.41 Kgs/Litres
Previous
• The variances noted imply weakening of stock controls with regards to wheat bran, Utto and yeast materials’ movement.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread/Dough Weight
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • We conducted a spot check on the weights of packed bread on 3rd February 2025 to verify if the set bread weight standards were being adhered to.
  • Underweights were noted in 400g CTW Unit 2-(27/43), 600g CTw Unit 2-(29/54), 6BT Unit 1(12/60) and 8BT Unit 1 (14/50)
  • There were Over-weights noted in Unit 1 600g BT(4/60) and Unit 2 600g CTW(11/54) as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation:
• The branch management to increase spot checks in the production area and ensure that the workforce is trained/sensitizes on the required weight standards and weighing procedures.

  • Regular machine maintenance is recommended.
attributes.effect: • Presence of underweight bread signified lapses in implementation of the set dough weights and also failure to monitor production process flow.

value: • We had ovens that had issues in Unit 2  that led to underweights and they are currently being repaired to avoid such scenarios in future

• We had reported the ovens in the Unit that had issues and we requested to stop production but since this was not possible, there was loss of weight noted. However, we have cut shifts and have the ovens under repair and maintenance.
•  In the previous audit report, it was noted that 400 grams Barrel had a significant percentage of underweight at 81%.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings

  • An analysis was done on the bread damage levels for both production and market based deformities for the period 15th January-2nd February 2025 to detect if damage levels were within the set limits.
  • We noted the following:
    • Production damages were 0.25% of the total production which was above the set standard of 0.2% and had a cost implication of KES 10,611.60.
    • Market damages were 0.56% of the total sales which was above the 0.5% allowed limit and had a cost implication of KES 12,263.40.
attributes.recommendation:
• Enhance controls and spot checks within the production process.
  • Training employees on handling bread in transit to minimize market damages.
  • Regular oven machines maintenance
attributes.effect: • The bread damages exceeded the set damage limits implying lapses in monitoring production flow, machine breakdowns and mishandling of bread in transit.

value: • We had instances of oven breakdowns that contributed to production damages but we will work on minimizing this.
• Frequent Oven breakdowns led to production and market damages but we will work on minimizing this
• During the prior audit dated 6th December 2024, it was noted that production damages were 0.25% of the total production while market damages were 0.52% of the total sales.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • We conducted an analysis of both the mixing chart and mixing chart summaries for the period 15th January to 2nd February 2025 to determine if the raw materials’ consumption were as per the set BOM and if the set yield and quality standards were achieved for production.
  • We noted the following:
    • Average yield was 190.96 loaves per bag
    • Average production was 110.37 bags equivalent to 73.09% of the set target of 151 bags.
    • Utto units consumption to bags of flour ratio was 1:1
    • 192 cases of remixes were observed for the reviewed audit period as detailed in the table below:
attributes.recommendation: • The branch management to improve on yield and production target achievement.
attributes.effect: • 73.09% production target achievement and 190.96 average yield indicated that there was room for improvement.

value:
•       We had oven breakdowns and shift cuts therefore we could not achieve our target.
  • The yield is low due to many varieties.
• Oven breakdowns and low sales led to low production since we had to control balances from our end.

·       During the prior audit, the following were noted :

  • Utto usage ratio 100 %,

  •   Average yield  191.12

  •   Average production 126.28 bags.

  • Remixes 180
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • Verification of cash held at the cashier’s office was done on 5th February 2025, to confirm if the cash balances tallied with cash-flow records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to given that the branch sales were on cash basis.
  • We noted that there was a variance of KES +42 in cash balances attributed to high amount of coins from cash customers along the routes.
  • We also observed that there were no pending IOUs.
attributes.recommendation: • The branch management to ensure Nil variation in cash balances
attributes.effect: • There was negligible variance in the cash balances, therefore the cash controls were sufficient.

value: • This is okay, we will maintain

• We will confirm the excess and adjust our cash-flow balances to reflect this.
  • We will maintain cash controls and improve further
•   In the prior audit report dated 6th December 2024, it was noted that there was no material variance.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Minishop Spot Check
attributes.description:
Findings.

  •  A spot check on Mini shop was done on 1st February 2025 to determine if all loaded bread was accounted for and if the sales were equivalent to the till  balances given that the mini-shop did not accept physical cash.
  • We noted that all the sales done as at the time of the spot check were accounted for and all the expected bread balances from loading done exclusive of sales were physically available.
attributes.recommendation: • The management should maintain the Mini shop controls and keep track of transaction charges.
attributes.effect: • The Mini shop was well controlled.

value: • We will maintain and improve further.
• We will maintain and improve further.
• In the previous audit, Minishop was well controlled with Nil variance.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • An assessment was conducted on the utilization of packers in the slicing section to determine if optimality was attained based on the set Company standard of 97 crates per packer.
  • We noted that, for the period 15th January-2nd February 2025, the packing efficiency stood at 94.04 crates which was below the standard set as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: • The branch management to maintain optimal allocation of packers based on the set standards.
attributes.effect: • The branch did not attain the set slicing efficiency implying extra cost of KES 8,208 incurred in paying excess 9 workers.

value: • We will follow up to ensure we attain the target.
• We will follow up to ensure we attain the target.
• The previous audit report dated 6th December 2024 indicated a packing efficiency of 87.56 crates per packer.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • We reviewed the branch’s production efficiency rate versus the Company’s set standards for the period 15th January to 2nd February 2025 to ascertain if there were any major variations.
  • We noted that the average production efficiency was at 4.07 bags per production worker which was below the set standard of 4.3.
  • The results were as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: • Branch management to introduce controls to ensure optimal allocation of employees to the production section.
attributes.effect: • The branch did not attain the set target implying extra cost of KES 27,771.47 for over-allocation of 26 extra workers to the production section.

value: • Oven breakdowns affected the achievement of the production target
• Oven breakdowns hindered our production efficiency attainment.
• The previous audit report dated 6th December 2024 indicated a production efficiency of 4.14 bags per production worker.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • A review was conducted on the branch vehicles’ fuel consumption vis a vis the set standard consumption rate to determine if there was optimal utilization of fuel for the period 1st -31st January 2025.
  • We noted that all route vehicles’ fuel consumptions were within the set standard as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: • Maintain and enhance the fuel management controls within the branch.
attributes.effect: • The fuel management controls at the branch were effective.

value: • We will maintain
• We will maintain
• During the previous audit, it was noted that three Tuk-tuks’ Fuel consumption rate were higher than their standard of 18Km per litre. due to excess distance covered during top up by sales personnel

Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Debtors' Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

  • An analysis of the debt balances as at C.O.B 04/02/2025 (Exclusive of Institutions) was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route. The findings were as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: •  Follow up on pending balances for clearance.
attributes.effect: • Debt balances were minimal, therefore well controlled, however efforts should be made to recover the pending balances.

value: • We are following up with sales rep for clearance.
• We are following up with sales rep for clearance.
• The previous audit noted that most routes had zero balances and prepaid balances while other routes had minimal balances.
